item.title: How to recover a deleted document
item.description: Introduction This article describes how you might be able to recover data in Cloudant after it has been deleted or overwritten. Photo by Joshua Coleman on Unsplash Deleting a Cloudant document leaves behind a so-called tombstone - a shell of the original document containing only an _id/_rev pair and a _deleted: true flag. Soon after deletion (or after updating a document), the previous revision’s document body is removed in a process called “compaction”.
